alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 1:22PM EDT until May 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding in the Weston area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danforth, Amity, Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Wytopitlock, Weston, Orient, Bancroft and Glenwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
